item.title: 投资者为更多经济数据做好准备，期货持稳
item.description: 美国股指期货周三表现低迷，投资者在等待本周一系列经济数据，包括生产者价格和零售销售数据，以寻找美联储降息路径的线索。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were subdued on Wednesday as investors awaited a slew of economic data this week, including producer prices and retail sales numbers, for clues on the Federal Reserve's rate-cut path.】

item.title: 媒体报道出售 Optus 消息后，新加坡电信股价大涨 4%，随后停盘
item.description: 澳大利亚金融评论》（AFR）报道新加坡电信（SingTel）正在就出售其澳大利亚电信子公司 Optus 进行深入谈判后，该公司股价周三上涨近 4%，随后跌停。【原文：Singapore Telecommunications (SingTel) shares rose nearly 4% before being halted on Wednesday after the Australian Financial Review (AFR) reported the company was in advanced talks to sell its Australian telecommunications subsidiary Optus.】

item.title: 据 rbb 报道，特斯拉德国工厂已开始生产并投入运行
item.description: 据当地电台广播公司 rbb 报道，特斯拉位于德国格鲁恩海德的欧洲千兆工厂周三重新开始生产，此前，附近一座电塔遭到纵火袭击，导致工厂停电数日。【原文：Production started up again on Wednesday at Tesla's European gigafactory in Gruenheide, Germany, local radio broadcaster rbb reported, after an arson attack on a nearby electricity pylon led to a days-long power outage at the plant.】

item.title: 瑞士交易所运营商 SIX 因减值损失 11.5 亿美元
item.description: 瑞士证券交易所运营商 SIX 公布 2023 年亏损 10.1 亿瑞士法郎（约合 11.5 亿美元），此前，该公司计入了两项之前已公布的非现金减值。【原文：Swiss stock exchange operator SIX reported a loss of 1.01 billion Swiss francs ($1.15 billion) in 2023, after it booked two previously flagged non-cash impairments.】

item.title: 上田表示，日本央行认为工资谈判是刺激政策退出时机的关键
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫表示，公司与工会之间正在进行的年度春季工资谈判对于决定何时逐步取消大规模刺激计划至关重要。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said the ongoing annual spring wage negotiations between companies and unions are critical in deciding when to phase out its massive stimulus programme.】

item.title: 美罗银行在最后一刻推出拯救方案后，年度亏损额有所减少
item.description: 英国麦德龙银行（Metro Bank）周三公布的年度亏损额有所减少，原因是该行努力削减成本，并且在年底前进行了紧急注资，使资金流出趋于稳定。【原文：British lender Metro Bank posted a smaller annual loss on Wednesday, supported by its cost-cutting efforts and as outflows stabilised towards the end of the year after an eleventh-hour capital injection.】

item.title: 得益于新车，大众汽车预计西欧订单增长
item.description: 大众汽车（Volkswagen）周三表示，由于德国汽车制造商推出了新车型，预计未来几个月西欧的订单量将加速增长。【原文：Volkswagen said on Wednesday that it expects incoming orders in Western Europe to pick up speed in the coming months thanks to the German carmaker's new models.】

item.title: 日本加息预示金融市场进入新时代
item.description: 就在日本股市突破三十年高点仅几周之后，该国金融市场正急速走向另一个一代人中最长时期内从未见过的现象：利率上升。【原文：Barely weeks after Japanese stocks broke three-decade highs, the country's financial markets are hurtling toward another phenomenon not seen for the best part of a generation: rising interest rates.】

item.title: Zara 所有者 Inditex 将赌注押在高档时装和有竞争力的价格上，2023 年利润将增长 30%，达到 54 亿欧元
item.description: Zara 的所有者 Inditex 周三表示，由于这家快速时尚巨头将赌注押在高端购物者身上，并提供比 H&M 等竞争对手更具竞争力的价格，其 2023 年的净收入增长了 30%，达到 54 亿欧元（59 亿美元）。【原文：Zara owner Inditex said on Wednesday its net income for 2023 rose by 30% to 5.4 billion euros ($5.9 billion) as the fast-fashion giant bet on upmarket shoppers and offered more competitive prices than rivals such as H&M .】

item.title: 阿迪达斯警告 2024 年北美市场库存过剩销售额将下滑
item.description: 德国体育用品巨头阿迪达斯周三表示，预计今年在北美的销售额将出现下滑，原因是北美市场的库存仍然过剩，该公司正在继续出售其被砍掉的Yeezy系列运动鞋。【原文：German sportswear giant Adidas said on Wednesday it expects a decline in its sales in North America this year, blaming a still overstocked market there, as the company continues to sell off the sneakers from its axed Yeezy line.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行确认 2024-2026 年利润目标和红利
item.description: 法国最大的银行法国巴黎银行周三确认了未来三年的盈利目标和股息分配。【原文：BNP Paribas , France's largest bank, on Wednesday confirmed its profitability targets and dividend payouts for the coming three years.】

item.title: Zalando 预计 2024 年 GMV 将增长 0%-5
item.description: 德国在线时尚零售商 Zalando 周三表示，在报告了全年销售额下降之后，该公司预计将在 2024 年恢复增长，这符合其自身的预测范围。【原文：German online fashion retailer Zalando said on Wednesday it expects to return to growth in 2024, after reporting full-year decline in sales, in line with its own forecast range.】

item.title: 美国商务部长表示，美国企业热衷于实现供应链多样化，为泰国投资 "增效
item.description: 美国商务部长吉娜-雷蒙多（Gina Raimondo）周三表示，泰国是希望实现供应链多样化的美国跨国公司的重中之重，他们已准备好 "加速 "对该国的投资。【原文：Thailand is a top priority for U.S. multinational firms looking to diversify supply chains, and they are ready to "supercharge" investments into the country, U.S. Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 地产巨头在戛纳寻找市场转机的线索
item.description: 在经历了十多年来最严重的暴跌之后，全球房地产业正在努力寻找乐观的理由，开发商和投资者都在大谈复苏的前景--只是还没有完全复苏。【原文：The global real estate industry is scrabbling around for reasons to be optimistic in the grip of its biggest crash in more than a decade, with developers and investors talking up the prospect of a recovery - just not quite yet.】

item.title: 瑞士信贷倒闭一年后欧洲银行艰难复苏
item.description: 一年前，瑞士信贷濒临倒闭，这一恐慌导致欧洲银行股价暴跌，违约保险成本飙升。【原文：A year ago Credit Suisse was teetering on the brink of collapse, a scare that sent European bank shares tumbling and the cost of insuring against default soaring.】

item.title: 房贷违约率上升给中国家庭带来更多痛苦
item.description: 在中国南方某城市，前财务人员雷晓宇因拖欠房贷而被追债者追逐，她不再接听电话，试图拖延不可避免的困境。【原文：Chased by debt collectors over a mortgage delinquency in a southern Chinese city, former finance worker Lei Xiaoyu no longer answers her phone as she tries to delay the inevitable.】

item.title: HelloFresh 投资者难以接受战略调整
item.description: 投资者和分析师认为，HelloFresh 需要削减成本，阻止套餐用户外流，以提高利润，重振股价。【原文：HelloFresh needs to cut costs and stem an exodus of meal-kit subscribers to boost profits and revive its share price, according to investors and analysts, who remain to be convinced by a plan to expand its fledging ready-meals arm.】

item.title: 随着对华贸易的蓬勃发展，一些俄罗斯公司也在蓬勃发展
item.description: 尼基塔-米南科夫（Nikita Minenkov）的物流公司位于中俄边境的阿穆尔河附近，生意一直很好。自莫斯科入侵乌克兰以来，公司的经营状况更上一层楼--公司营业额连续两年翻了一番。【原文：Business at Nikita Minenkov's logistics company, based near the Amur River that marks the border between Russia and China, was going well. Since Moscow's invasion of Ukraine it's gone even better - company turnover has doubled for two years running.】

item.title: E.ON 老板说，欧洲不需要 "空中客车 "这样的能源公司
item.description: E.ON 首席执行官告诉路透社记者，E.ON 没有兴趣创建一个泛欧洲的超大型公用事业公司，并驳斥了近期能源市场动荡可能会刺激该行业整合的说法。【原文：E.ON has no interest in creating a pan-European mega-utility, its CEO told Reuters, rejecting suggestions that recent energy market turmoil might spur consolidation in the sector.】

item.title: 欧洲 日本工资协议将日本央行置于中心位置
item.description: Tom Westbrook 展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook】

item.title: 美股可能没有泡沫，但回调可能近在眼前
item.description: 一些市场人士认为，尽管目前仍不清楚股市是处于泡沫还是强劲牛市，但美国股市的无情上涨已准备好喘息。【原文：Some market participants believe the relentless U.S. stock rally is poised for a breather, even if it remains unclear whether equities are in a bubble or a strong bull run.】

item.title: 市场：结束银行 "窗口指导 "的举措或将重塑美国回购市场
item.description: 全球监管机构建议改变最大的银行在年底报告关键风险指标的方式，这可能会对它们在美国的短期融资业务造成打击，这也是收紧资本规则之战的最新一炮。【原文：A proposal by global regulators to change how the largest banks report key risk metrics at the end of the year could deal a blow to their U.S. short-term funding businesses, the latest salvo in a battle over tighter capital rules.】

item.title: 国泰航空四年来首次实现年度盈利
item.description: 香港国泰航空公司（Cathay Pacific Airways）周三公布了2023年97.9亿港元（12.5亿美元）的盈利报告，这是该公司四年来首次实现年度盈利，并表示其目标是在今年第二季度内达到疫情前客运航班的80%。【原文：Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways reported on Wednesday a HK$9.79 billion ($1.25 billion) profit for 2023, its first annual profit in four years, and said it aims to reach 80% of its pre-pandemic passenger flights within the second quarter of this year.】

item.title: 澳大利亚普华永道因税务计划泄露丑闻再裁员 300 多人
item.description: 普华永道澳大利亚公司周三表示，该公司将再裁员 329 人，这是继一名前合伙人泄露政府税收计划的全国性丑闻之后进行的重大重组的一部分。【原文：PwC Australia on Wednesday said it would cut an additional 329 jobs, part of a major restructuring that follows a national scandal in which a former partner leaked government tax plans.】

item.title: 股市超越美国通胀率，创下里程碑式新高
item.description: 在华尔街创下历史最高纪录的背景下，亚洲股市周三创下七个月来的新高，原因是投资者大多对美国通胀略高于预期的情况不以为然，并押注这不会破坏今年年中降息的预期。【原文：Asian shares notched seven month highs on Wednesday, on the back of record peaks on Wall Street, as investors mostly shrugged off slightly hotter-than-expected U.S. inflation, betting it won't derail interest rate cuts expected by the middle of the year.】

item.title: 中国电动车巨头比亚迪推出起售价更低的新版 e2 掀背车
item.description: 中国电动汽车巨头比亚迪周三推出了新版 e2 电动掀背车，起售价低于上一代车型。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle giant BYD on Wednesday launched a new version of e2 EV hatchback with a lower starting price than its predecessor.】

item.title: 交易员权衡通胀热度高于预期，美元走稳
item.description: 周三，美元兑几种主要货币持稳，因为交易员们在权衡比预期更热的通胀数据会对美联储在 6 月份会议上降息的可能性产生何种影响。【原文：The U.S. dollar held steady against a handful of rival currencies on Wednesday, as traders weighed what impact hotter-than-expected inflation data could have on chances of an interest rate cut at the Federal Reserve's June meeting.】

item.title: 零售商沃尔玛将在 2024 年投资约 20 亿美元
item.description: 据周二公布的一份文件显示，墨西哥零售商沃尔玛将在 2024 年投资约 345 亿比索（约合 20.5 亿美元），同比增长 19%。【原文：Mexican retailer Walmex is set to invest around 34.5 billion pesos ($2.05 billion) in 2024, up 19% from previous year, according to a filing published on Tuesday.】

item.title: 油价因美国需求强劲而上涨，美联储信号受关注
item.description: 油价周三上涨，原因是市场预期全球需求强劲，包括世界第一大消费国美国的需求，而且即使美国通胀略显疲软，也没有削弱美联储可能很快开始降息的预期。【原文：Oil prices rose on Wednesday on expectations of strong global demand, including in the world's top consumer the United States, and as even somewhat sticky U.S. inflation did not dent expectations the Fed might start cutting rates soon.】

item.title: KKR 将向菲律宾电信塔业务投资 4 亿美元
item.description: 美国商务部周三表示，私募股权公司 KKR & Co 将投资 4 亿美元用于菲律宾电信塔的运营和扩张，这是在一个具有里程碑意义的贸易代表团中宣布的 10 亿美元投资中的一系列交易之一。【原文：Private equity firm KKR & Co will invest $400 million in telecoms tower operations and expansion in the Philippines, the U.S. Department of Commerce said on Wednesday, among a slew of deals in a $1 billion investment announced in a landmark trade mission.】
